verses.kjv: Plead my cause, O LORD, with them that strive with me: fight against them that fight against me.
verses.ct: Take up my case, LORD, against those who oppose me. Battle against those who battle against me.

verses.kjv: Take hold of shield and buckler, and stand up for mine help.
verses.ct: Grab your shield and armor, and rise up to help me.

verses.kjv: Draw out also the spear, and stop the way against them that persecute me: say unto my soul, I am thy salvation.
verses.ct: Pull out your spear and block the path of those who chase me down. Tell my soul, 'I am your salvation.'

verses.kjv: Let them be confounded and put to shame that seek after my soul: let them be turned back and brought to confusion that devise my hurt.
verses.ct: Let those who are trying to kill me be humiliated and disgraced. Let those who plot to harm me be driven back in total confusion.

verses.kjv: Let them be as chaff before the wind: and let the angel of the LORD chase them.
verses.ct: Let them become like straw blown by the wind, with the angel of the LORD driving them away.

verses.kjv: Let their way be dark and slippery: and let the angel of the LORD persecute them.
verses.ct: Let their path be dark and slippery, with the angel of the LORD pursuing them.

verses.kjv: For without cause have they hid for me their net in a pit, which without cause they have digged for my soul.
verses.ct: For no reason at all, they set a hidden trap for me. Without any cause, they dug a pit to catch my soul.

verses.kjv: Let destruction come upon him at unawares; and let his net that he hath hid catch himself: into that very destruction let him fall.
verses.ct: Let ruin overtake them by surprise. Let the very net they hid ensnare them — let them tumble into their own destruction.

verses.kjv: And my soul shall be joyful in the LORD: it shall rejoice in his salvation.
verses.ct: Then my soul will celebrate in the LORD; it will find joy in his salvation.

verses.kjv: All my bones shall say, LORD, who is like unto thee, which deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him, yea, the poor and the needy from him that spoileth him?
verses.ct: Every part of me will cry out, 'LORD, who compares to you? You rescue the weak from those who overpower them — the poor and needy from those who rob them.'

verses.kjv: False witnesses did rise up; they laid to my charge things that I knew not.
verses.ct: Dishonest witnesses stood up and accused me of things I had no knowledge of.

verses.kjv: They rewarded me evil for good to the spoiling of my soul.
verses.ct: They paid me back with evil for the good I had done, leaving my soul devastated.

verses.kjv: But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth: I humbled my soul with fasting; and my prayer returned into mine own bosom.
verses.ct: But when they were sick, I wore rough cloth in mourning. I denied myself food and prayed with my head bowed low.

verses.kjv: I behaved myself as though he had been my friend or brother: I bowed down heavily, as one that mourneth for his mother.
verses.ct: I treated them as if they were my close friends or my own brothers. I walked around grieving deeply, like someone mourning the loss of his mother.

verses.kjv: But in mine adversity they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together: yea, the abjects gathered themselves together against me, and I knew it not; they did tear me, and ceased not:
verses.ct: Yet when I stumbled, they celebrated and ganged up on me. Attackers I didn't even recognize gathered against me, tearing me apart without stopping.

verses.kjv: With hypocritical mockers in feasts, they gnashed upon me with their teeth.
verses.ct: Like godless mockers at a feast, they ground their teeth at me.

verses.kjv: Lord, how long wilt thou look on? rescue my soul from their destructions, my darling from the lions.
verses.ct: Lord, how long will you just watch this happen? Rescue my soul from their attacks — save my precious life from these lions.

verses.kjv: I will give thee thanks in the great congregation: I will praise thee among much people.
verses.ct: I will thank you in the great assembly; I will praise you among the crowds of people.

verses.kjv: Let not them that are mine enemies wrongfully rejoice over me: neither let them wink with the eye that hate me without a cause.
verses.ct: Don't let my enemies gloat over me when they have no right to. Don't let those who hate me for no reason smirk at each other.

verses.kjv: For they speak not peace: but they devise deceitful matters against them that are quiet in the land.
verses.ct: They never talk about peace. Instead, they cook up lies against those who live quietly in the land.

verses.kjv: Yea, they opened their mouth wide against me, and said, Aha, aha, our eye hath seen it.
verses.ct: They opened their mouths wide against me and said, 'Ha! We saw it with our own eyes!'

verses.kjv: This thou hast seen, O LORD: keep not silence: O Lord, be not far from me.
verses.ct: You have seen all of this, LORD — don't stay silent! Lord, don't stay distant from me.

verses.kjv: Stir up thyself, and awake to my judgment, even unto my cause, my God and my Lord.
verses.ct: Wake up and rise to my defense! Fight for my cause, my God and my Lord.

verses.kjv: Judge me, O LORD my God, according to thy righteousness; and let them not rejoice over me.
verses.ct: Vindicate me according to your righteousness, LORD my God, and don't let them gloat over me.

verses.kjv: Let them not say in their hearts, Ah, so would we have it: let them not say, We have swallowed him up.
verses.ct: Don't let them think to themselves, 'This is exactly what we wanted!' Don't let them say, 'We have completely destroyed him.'

verses.kjv: Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion together that rejoice at mine hurt: let them be clothed with shame and dishonour that magnify themselves against me.
verses.ct: Let everyone who celebrates my suffering be disgraced and humiliated together. Let those who elevate themselves over me be covered in shame and dishonor.

verses.kjv: Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favour my righteous cause: yea, let them say continually, Let the LORD be magnified, which hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.
verses.ct: But let those who support my righteous cause shout with joy and gladness. Let them always say, 'The LORD is great — he delights in the well-being of his servant.'

verses.kjv: And my tongue shall speak of thy righteousness and of thy praise all the day long.
verses.ct: My tongue will declare your righteousness and speak your praise all day long.
